results.title: The Car ahead
results.creator_credit: Commonwealth Department of Transport, Film Australia and Telemark Productions
results.brief_description:
Episode number 2 of Series “The Skills of Defensive Driving”.
Demonstrates the reaction time between a signal to brake and the application of the brake by the driver. Advises on precautions to be taken when following another vehicle. Suitable for upper secondary level.

results.title: Calling Sydney Harbour
results.creator_credit: Malcolm Otton, Eric Thompson and Australian Commonwealth Film Unit
results.brief_description: Shows aspects of the commerce on Sydney Harbour. Also reveals the changing face of Sydney from the tugboats that work in the port.

results.title: Cairns
results.creator_credit: Eric Thompson and Australian Commonwealth Film Unit
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Life in Australia”.
Describes the daily life, scenery and products of Cairns, a small city situated in the tropical far north of Queensland.

results.title: By-pass
results.creator_credit: Arch Nicholson and Australian Commonwealth Film Unit
results.brief_description: A short film illustrating a typical administrative problem for discussion. Two office workers produce innovative designs that may prove to have long range cost-saving benefits. Neither of their superiors appears to be appreciative. One designer decides to by-pass his approach to his superior. Suitable for upper secondary level.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Arch Nicholson and Australian Commonwealth Film Unit

results.title: By design
results.creator_credit: Geoffrey Collings and Australian National Film Board
results.brief_description: A jet plane, a boomerang, and a locomotive are shown as examples of successful design in which the right materials are used for the right purposes. Showing examples of the work of Australia’s industrial designers, the film explains that the purpose for which an article is intended determines the final design. Examples include household articles such as an electric iron, comfortable chairs, lamps, and saucepans.

results.title: The Bushman goes home
results.creator_credit: Eric Bedford and Australian National Film Board
results.brief_description: A cattle station owner makes the long journey from his vast cattle station on the Gulf of Carpentaria to visit Melbourne and the cattle saleyards. He then flies back via the cattle fattening plains of New South Wales. Narrated by Nigel Lovell.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Eric Bedford and Australian National Film Board

results.title: Birds and billabongs
results.creator_credit: Charles P. Mountford and Australian National Film Board
results.brief_description: Records the 1948 Arnhem Land Expedition, sponsored by the national Geographic Society, the Smithsonian Institute of America and the Commonwealth Government. Shows various types of birds found in Arnhem Land including terns, plovers, Burdekin ducks, sharp-tailed sand pipers, geese, royal spoonbills, the snake bird, brolgas, white necked heron, the egret and the lotus bird. The sound track includes actual recordings of bird song.

results.title: Behind the big top
results.brief_description: Wirth’s circus comes to town! The arrival of the circus at Melbourne and their preparations for a performance. Suitable for children 6+ years old.
results.description: Wirth’s circus comes to town! The arrival of the circus at Melbourne and their preparations for a performance. Suitable for children 6+ years old.

results.title: Barrier story
results.creator_credit: Hugh Alexander, Eric Thompson and Australian National Film Board
results.brief_description: Shows the city and people of Broken Hill, situated on one of the richest silver, lead and zinc fields in the world. Emphasis is laid on the rapid development of Broken Hill into a modern mining community with all the facilities for pleasant living and recreation. There is wealth and security, social progress and industrial peace in the ‘Barrier City’.
